did.abstract: Physician, proponent of abortion law reform; correspondence and other papers relating to his efforts to enact abortion reform.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was received from Dr. Stack (donor no. 5719).

accruals.p: No further additions to the papers are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Jack M. Stack papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Jack M. Stack is a physician from Alma, Michigan. He has served as vice-president of the Michigan Council to Study Abortion, and chairman of the Michigan Coordinating Committee for Abortion Law Reform.

scopecontent.p: The Stack collection consists of correspondence and other papers concerning his efforts to enact abortion law reform in Michigan. Several files relate to the National Association for the Repeal of Abortion Laws.
